ai.summary: The Grand Tour Yellow route is a short, easy 3.9 km hike in the UK. With gentle grades and well-marked paths, it suits beginners and casual walkers looking for a relaxed outdoor experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly well-trodden paths with gentle climbs. Expect a mix of grassy trails, compact gravel, and some uneven or muddy sections. Footing is generally stable, but moderate care may be needed in damp conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Check local conditions before you go. Wear sturdy footwear and bring water. Stay on marked paths and be prepared for changes in weather common in the UK. Carry a map or GPS device, and let someone know your plans, especially if hiking alone. In winter, daylight is limited and surfaces can be slippery.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or light boots
Map or offline map on a smartphone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer the best conditions and longest daylight; winter can be cold, wet, and muddy.
